data.content:
used in writing to represent the sound of the phrase got you when it is spoken quickly
She ran after him, grabbed him by the arm, and said Gotcha! [=I got you; I caught you]
We'll have to leave soon, so be ready. Gotcha. [=I have got you; I understand]
The pronunciation represented by gotcha occurs only in very informal speech. The written form should be avoided except when you are trying to represent or record such speech.
noun
plural -chas
[count] US informal :an unexpected problem or usually unpleasant surprise
The program has a few gotchas in store for unsuspecting computer users.
